abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column highlights discrepancy in prison sentences between Judith Clark, getaway driver in Brink's armored-car robbery in Rockland County in 1981, and sentence for mastermind Mutulu Shakur; notes group of prominent New York lawyers have called on Gov Andrew M Cuomo to grant clemency to Clark, who is ineligible for parole, whereas ringleader Shakur, who along with others killed Brinks guard and two police officers during heist, has already been released on parole.
lead_paragraph: Judith Clark, who played a far smaller role in a 1981 armored-car robbery than Mutulu Shakur, will not be eligible for release until well after he is.

headline.main: When Parole Rules Keep Getaway Driver Locked Up the Longest
headline.print_headline: An Accomplice Feels the Sting of Parole Rules

snippet: Judith Clark, who played a far smaller role in a 1981 armored-car robbery than Mutulu Shakur, will not be eligible for release until well after he is.
